reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building was beautifully furnished and the ambiance was everything we could hope for. We stayed in a historic room and the bed was divine. The provided soaps and shampoos are spa quality and the food at the restaurant was superb! The only complaint would be the speed of service at the restaurant. It literally took hours and we had to hunt down wait staff for simple things like flatware. This may have been an early-season glitch. (Hopefully because we plan to stay again.)
reviews.title: The La Veta Inn is a jewel!

reviews.text: Overall it was a wonderful experience. The talented, Tom Munch performed on the patio adding to the ambiance.
reviews.title: Perfect end to a perfect day!!!

reviews.text: Forgiven
reviews.title: Outstanding - we'll be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our son had his wedding at the Cuchara Chapel July 16 and then we went to the La Veta Inn for the reception. I don't know where to begin to say how wonderful it was!!!!! All the tables were decorated exactly like we had asked and the food was awesome!!!! The entire staff worked continuously to make sure our huge crew was taken care of!!! Never had to wait on anything!!!! A big thank you to Alice for all her work the day of the reception and all the days leading up to it!!! We greatly appreciate your patience. It was a little nerve wracking trying to plan this living 4 hours away, but she was instrumental in making it a perfect end to a perfect day!!!!!! Also, we had family and friends stay overnight at the Inn.....everyone was more than impressed with the rooms!!! Thank you again and look forward to getting there again soon!!!!
reviews.title: Very nice but with some exceptions.

reviews.text: The La Veta Inn is truly a special place....much like an en-suite European hotel......very cozy...Take your complimentary continental breakfast and coffee out front and sit and enjoy the cool Colorado mornings at one of several tables...watch the deer wander thru the park across the steet while you sip your coffee....take dinner inside in the dining room or outside in the open air courtyard - truly a superb dinner menu with several maintstays such as rack of lamb, flatiron steak, and a wonderful spiced rubbed pork chop to daily specials like halibut, snapper, and pasta - I had the rack of lamb, pork
reviews.title: One of the coolest Inns I've ever stayed at

reviews.text: We travelled here for one night with our 9 year old son and adjusted our plans to stay another. The town is great with fabulous day trips, You must eat at Alys's resturant, she will really look after you. The food was the best we ate over four states. Play backgamom, chess or yatzhee whilst listening to top class musicians. Have a drink at the bar and eat their famous home made crisps. All of the staff treated us like family members. If we lived in the USA we would definatley be back here and reccomend it. We would love to stay a week or two.
reviews.title: Best food, service and atmosphere over our 2 week/ 4 state road trip. This hotel has that special X Factor!

reviews.text: Visiting the La Veta Inn was a wonderful experience. I was with my husband and two teenage girls and we shared a lovely suite. Kurt, the new owner, showcased local artist's work in the rooms as well as throughout the inn. The rooms were clean and the bedding felt luxurious. I also liked the fine detail represented by organic body wash, soaps and shampoos. Dinner was delicious:don't leave without ordering Alice's famous "whiskey pudding"! People are very friendly, the owner was very attentive and I would recommend the inn to any one who loves the southwest, local art, great food and genuine, friendly people!
reviews.title: Breath of Fresh Air!

reviews.text: I sat in the charming and inviting lobby on a comfortable couch sipping tea,
reviews.title: Can't wait to return

reviews.text: having wonderful conversation with people I'd never met before. Some were
reviews.title: Disturbing experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: people from La Veta, others were also staying at the Inn.
reviews.title: If You are in the Area, a Nice Place to Stay

reviews.text: The rooms were very nice and mine had some wonderful artwork....the beds were very comfortable but the food was unquestionably the highlight. I had four meals there and the family ordered 6-7 items from the menu each time and there wasn't anything that wasn't better than I expected. The cost (for the room and the food) was extremely reasonable and the service was excellent.
reviews.title: Great place and the food was unbelievable....I am now a friend of Alice too

reviews.text: Beautifully decorated, but they are missing practicality. Roaches in the room, bed missing top sheet. Very slick tile on the shower floor, no grab bars, very low toilet, cooling system not adequate. Continental breakfast so so.
reviews.title: Too pricey for accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed great service from the front desk throughout our stay. Anything we requested was provided. They bent over backwards to accommodate guests. The room was delightful and colorful and the bed was very comfortable. We particularly liked the extra room (a little "dining room" with sink, table & chairs, fridge, microwave and toaster) since it was a good place to stay up if the other was tired and wanted lights out.
reviews.title: Great Getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was fun wandering around the galleries and we loved the museum. Be sure to take a drive up the Highway of Legends to enjoy the scenery.
reviews.title: Outstanding in all areas!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We celebrated my birthday at the Inn eating a fabulous dinner from Alys' excellent menu. From the minute the bread basket was set down with fresh, homemade breads, we knew the meal would be amazing. It was. We had lunch there the next day and LOVED that everything, including the potato chips, was homemade. Delicious!
reviews.title: Small town surprise

reviews.text: We (me, my husband, and two sons) had a short, one night stay at the La Veta Inn, arriving around 10 pm following an evening at the Colorado State Fair/Rodeo in Pueblo. La Veta was a great location for us since we were planning go to the Great Sands Nat'l Park the next morning.
reviews.title: Convenient to the Great Sands Nat'l Park

reviews.text: The staff upon our arrival were very welcoming and even kept the bar opened a little late so that my husband and I could get a glass of wine to bring to our room.
reviews.title: We'll definitely be back. True Colorado mountain experience with an artistic touch.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the ground floor just beyond the lovely courtyard. It had two queen beds and a small couch and tv. There was also a bathroom, kitchenette with sink, microwave, small refridg and small kitchen table and two chairs.
reviews.title: Better than Taos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS: The quality of the bed linens and towels was excellent. They did point out to me that there was not a top sheet on the bed, but it was available in the closet. I put the sheets on the bed, since it was too warm to sleep under a down comforter. Nice quality soap and bath products.
reviews.title: A lovely inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The simple continental breakfast was very good. Cereal, fruit, oatmeal and two types of bread/coffee cakes that were yummy!
reviews.title: Warm and wonderful stay! We loved it!
